PerformAction.description: (Optional) Set this to 'Yes' to perform the action.

runCommand:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

if [ -f /etc/os-release ]; then
    . /etc/os-release
    OS_RELEASE="$ID${VERSION_ID:+.${VERSION_ID}}"
elif [ -f /etc/centos-release ]; then
    OS_RELEASE="centos.$(awk '{print $3}' /etc/centos-release)"
elif [ -f /etc/redhat-release ]; then
    OS_RELEASE="rhel.$(lsb_release -r | awk '{print $2}')"
fi

case "$OS_RELEASE" in
    amzn.2|centos.7*|centos.8*|fedora.*|rhel.7*|rhel.8*|sles*|ubuntu.20*)
        command_path='/usr/bin/'
        ;;
    amzn.2018.03|centos.6*|debian.*|rhel.6*|ubuntu.16*|ubuntu.18*)
        command_path='/bin/'
        ;;
    *)
        # Catch all without the full path for untested platforms
        command_path=''
esac

ExitWithFailureMessage() {
    MESSAGE="$1"
    JSON="$2"
    if [[ "$JSON" == "PRINT_JSON" ]]; then
        "${command_path}echo" "{\"error\":\"$MESSAGE\"}"
    fi
    WriteStandardError "$MESSAGE"
    exit 1
}

ExitWithSuccessMessage() {
    "${command_path}echo" "$1"
    exit 0
}

WriteStandardError() {
    MESSAGE="$1"
    (>&2 "${command_path}echo" "$MESSAGE")
}

TestPerformAction() {
    if [[ "$1" != "Yes" ]]; then
        ExitWithFailureMessage "No action was taken because the PerformAction parameter is set to $1. To make the desired change, set this parameter to Yes."
    fi
}

UserName='{{ UserName }}'

PERFORMACTION='{{ PerformAction }}'
TestPerformAction "$PERFORMACTION"

if ! "${command_path}grep" -q "^$UserName:" /etc/passwd; then
    ExitWithFailureMessage 'The specified user does not exist.' 'PRINT_JSON'
fi

if [ -f /usr/sbin/userdel ]; then
    COMMAND='/usr/sbin/userdel'
    ARGUMENT='--remove'
elif [ -f /usr/sbin/deluser ]; then
    COMMAND='/usr/sbin/deluser'
    ARGUMENT='--remove-home'
else
    ExitWithFailureMessage 'Neither of the required commands deluser or userdel exist.' 'PRINT_JSON'
fi

$COMMAND "$ARGUMENT" "$UserName" || ExitWithFailureMessage 'Failed to delete the specified user'
ExitWithSuccessMessage 'The specified user has been deleted.'
